page.title: 18HAILES WOOD 4 ECOLOGY
page.content: LIMESTONE WOOD The upper reaches of the wood are drier and contain characteristic calcicolous species:Ash ,small leaved lime, oak and hazel dominate.A variety of shrubs are also found: dogwood , spindle,elder and common buckthorn. {White }and {red admirals }can be seen feeding on bramble blossom.The foodplant of the white admiral, honeysuckle abounds in the undergrowth.Old hazel coppice provides shelter for warblers.They also support a wealth of invertebrates.The local longhorn beetle{Pogonocherus {hispidulus}has been found in the old branches. This wood contains a rich and varied flora and fauna and is well worth a visit.
